channel.title: Washington Post: Breaking News, World, US, DC News & Analysis
channel.description: Breaking news and analysis on politics, business, world national news, entertainment more. In-depth DC, Virginia, Maryland news coverage including traffic, weather, crime, education, restaurant reviews and more.

item.title: 7 things to know today: Impeachment vote; special election; Uber, Lyft strike; Super Bowl ratings; and more
item.description: What you need to know: Impeachment vote. New York election. NATO. Inflation. Uber strike. Super Bowl ratings. Shipwreck mystery.

item.title: After border bill failure, ICE considers mass releases to close budget gap
item.description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement is preparing to slash the number of immigrants in detention because it is running a $700 million budget deficit.

item.title: Suozzi wins New York special election, replacing George Santos
item.description: The Democrat prevailed in a race that centered heavily on immigration.

item.title: New marketing push by Ozempic and others sparks body-positive backlash
item.dc:creator: Shane O’Neill
item.description: Read more

item.title: These 5 science-based tips can improve your relationship
item.dc:creator: Richard Sima
item.description: Gratitude, laughter and holding hands are just some of the ways science shows couples can stay connected.

item.title: Does sex count as exercise?
item.dc:creator: Gretchen Reynolds
item.description: Sexual intercourse burns calories, raises the heart rate and rarely causes cardiac arrest.

item.title: We took $85 to five flower shops. Here’s what we got at each.
item.dc:creator: Fritz Hahn, Zoe Glasser, Sophia Solano and Ellen McCarthy
item.description: Flower arrangements don’t come cheap. We wanted to see how much beauty $85 could buy.

item.title: The anti-Valentine’s Day movement is gaining strength
item.dc:creator: Petula Dvorak
item.description: From painting their nails with dagger-pierced hearts to ghosting the social media love fest, teens are disconnecting from Valentine’s Day in an act of self-love.

item.title: A national art show of ‘American places’ shows off lots of D.C.
item.description: The National Gallery’s “American Places: Featuring Selections From the Corcoran Collection” features early 20th-century works alongside more recent D.C. art.

item.title: Parents of gun violence victims use AI to bring kids’ voices to Capitol Hill
item.description: The effort to re-create the voices of dead children reflects the desperation of so many parents who have repeatedly called for change.

item.title: Monumental’s arena plan guarantees hurt feelings and messy disputes
item.description: In the fight over a new Monumental arena, where are the winners? So far, that is among the missing details.

item.title: I’d only met my neighbor a few times. When she died I took in her dog.
item.description: As we walk the halls of the children’s hospital, I hope my neighbor is smiling, knowing how much joy her dog brings to everyone she meets.

item.title: What happens if Trump or Biden can no longer run for president?
item.description: The doomsday scenarios: What if Biden or Trump doesn’t make it to the finish line? We have answers.

item.description: My friend is upset — but only for now.

item.title: The broken promises of the NFL’s concussion settlement
item.dc:creator: Martine Powers
item.description: The “landmark” settlement promised payouts for suffering players. But a Washington Post investigation found that strict guidelines and aggressive reviews have led to denials for hundreds of players diagnosed with dementia, including many who died with CTE.

item.title: Have questions about dining out? Ask our food critic.
item.description: Washington Post food critic Tom Sietsema entertains your dining questions, rants and raves.

item.title: Denver Mayor Mike Johnston on how his city is handling influx of migrants
item.description: Denver is among several U.S. cities struggling to manage the influx of migrants arriving from the country’s Southern border. On Wednesday, Feb. 14 at 12:00 p.m. ET, Mayor Mike Johnston joins The Post’s Jonathan Capehart to discuss how Denver has handled the surge and what he would like to see from the federal government.

item.title: Carolyn Hax: Should he intervene in sister’s marriage to ‘obnoxious’ husband?
item.dc:creator: Carolyn Hax
item.description: Read more

item.title: Trump talks with Gabbard about U.S. defense, reflecting isolationist approach
item.dc:creator: Josh Dawsey, Ashley Parker and Dan Lamothe
item.description: Read more

item.title: Michael Whatley, Trump’s pick to run the RNC, already faces criticism
item.dc:creator: Isaac Stanley-Becker and Josh Dawsey
item.description: Michael Whatley, North Carolina’s GOP chairman, is Trump’s pick to lead the Republican National Committee alongside daughter-in-law Lara Trump.

item.title: Biden forcefully condemns Trump’s NATO comments as ‘un-American’
item.dc:creator: Amy B Wang
item.description: “It’s dumb. It’s shameful. It’s dangerous. It’s un-American,” Biden said Tuesday of Trump’s remarks at a campaign rally in South Carolina over the weekend.

item.title: Wisconsin Republicans vote to weaken their lock on the legislature
item.dc:creator: Patrick Marley
item.description: New maps approved Tuesday are expected to make control of Wisconsin’s legislature more competitive after years of GOP domination.

item.title: Trump will attend New York hearing on Thursday, but not the one in Georgia
item.dc:creator: Amy Gardner
item.description: Trump will not travel to Georgia for a hearing Thursday on allegations that Fulton County District Attorney Fani T. Willis (D) engaged in an improper personal relationship with the lead prosecutor on the election interference case, his lawyer announced Tuesday.

item.title: Trump asks Supreme Court to keep Jan. 6 trial on hold, citing 2024 election
item.dc:creator: Ann E. Marimow
item.description: In a filing on Monday, Donald Trump’s lawyer said putting him on trial during the 2024 election season would “radically disrupt” his effort to win another term in the White House.

item.title: Ask Amy: My husband ignores me during extended family vacations
item.description: Letter writer is ready to opt out of vacations with their husband’s extended family.

item.title: Miss Manners: How do I reconnect with my ex-girlfriend from college?
item.description: A letter writer wants to reconnect with an ex-girlfriend from college, decades after they broke up.

item.title: My co-parent and son are locked in a power struggle. What can I do?
item.description: What can you do about your co-parent and son’s constant power struggles?

item.title: Ask Elaine: Can I fix a 50-year friendship after she ghosted me?
item.description: My friend called me critical and then ghosted me. What should I do?

item.title: How long covid takes a toll on relationships and intimacy
item.dc:creator: Amanda Morris
item.description: Read more

item.title: Bunny love turned out to be the balm my anxious soul needed
item.dc:creator: Rona Kobell
item.description: I am the only one here all day to watch the two rabbits’ burgeoning relationship, which fascinates and moves me.

item.title: My funny valentine: How humor can sweeten — or sour — a relationship
item.dc:creator: Bob Brody
item.description: Some couples marry for money. Elvira and I married (more or less) for funny. Call it laughter at first sight.

item.title: How to stay friends for 50 years? Ask the women of Sugar Hill.
item.dc:creator: Kelyn Soong and Maya Valentine
item.description: While many people have friendships that span decades, the women of the Sugar Hill Sisterhood are a case study in what it takes to maintain them.

item.title: The remarkable power of holding hands with someone you love
item.dc:creator: Trisha Pasricha, MD
item.description: Studies show that holding hands can reduce pain and buffer stressful experiences. But its impact on brain activity suggests something more profound is going on.

item.title: Can we save nature with crazy shapes?
item.dc:creator: Harry Stevens
item.description: The U.N. wants to protect 30 percent of the planet. Many of the areas it counts towards that goal are small and oddly shaped. Can contorted shapes save nature?

item.title: Solar water heaters were cool in 1980s. They could be again.
item.dc:creator: Michael J. Coren
item.description: Why solar thermal panels, America’s forgotten solar, are poised to make a comeback.

item.title: This unexpected material might be in your next sweater
item.dc:creator: Nicolás Rivero
item.description: Dutch start-up Human Material Loop is part of a growing industry of recycling hair, including weaving clippings from salons and barbershops into clothes.

item.title: Why this is one of the planetary shifts scientists are most worried about
item.dc:creator: Sarah Kaplan
item.description: Research shows that the Atlantic Ocean’s sensitive circulation system is in danger, but scientists still don’t know how close it is to collapse.

item.title: After ‘off the charts’ ocean heat, NOAA expands alert system for coral bleaching
item.dc:creator: Amudalat Ajasa
item.description: Read more

item.title: New York City just posted its snowiest day in more than two years
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cappucci
item.description: About 3.2 inches fell in Central Park, but predictions were for even more. Several factors contributed to underperforming amounts.

item.title: Heavy snow blankets New York City as strong nor’easter sweeps Northeast
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cappucci
item.description: More than 10 inches of snow has fallen from eastern Pennsylvania to Connecticut.

item.title: In Photos: Snow blankets the Northeast as millions brace for powerful nor’easter
item.dc:creator: Washington Post staff
item.description: A swift-moving but intense storm system is sweeping up the Eastern Seaboard, plastering parts of the northern Mid-Atlantic and Northeast with quickly accumulating snowfall.

item.title: Meteorologists on cloud 9 after film trailer of ‘Twisters,’ coming this summer
item.dc:creator: Matthew Cappucci
item.description: The movie about tornado chasing will hit theaters on July 19.

item.title: True love means waiting to share your Netflix password
item.dc:creator: Heather Kelly
item.description: Sharing streaming and other accounts is a modern relationship milestone. Here’s when to consider it and why to wait.

item.title: 4 actually helpful uses for an AI chatbot
item.dc:creator: Shira Ovide
item.description: Do: “What’s another way to say ‘beautiful’ but without a romantic connotation?” Don’t: Ask for personalized shopping suggestions.

item.title: I lived inside a Vision Pro for two weeks. Here’s what it was like.
item.dc:creator: Chris Velazco
item.description: To see what “spatial computing” could really do for me, I wore the Vision Pro every day for two weeks. Here’s what you should know.

item.title: Microsoft, OpenAI say U.S. rivals use artificial intelligence in hacking
item.dc:creator: Joseph Menn
item.description: The report is the first to provide specifics of the use by U.S. rivals.

item.title: AI companies agree to limit election ‘deepfakes’ — but not to ban them
item.dc:creator: Gerrit De Vynck
item.description: Google, Microsoft, OpenAI, Meta, TikTok and Adobe developed an accord to respond to the proliferation of AI-generated content in elections.

item.title: Another private company to make historic try to land on the moon
item.dc:creator: Christian Davenport
item.description: If successful, it would be the first lunar landing by a U.S. vehicle since the last of the Apollo missions in 1972.

item.title: Indiana AG’s site to report school content ignites fear for teachers
item.dc:creator: Praveena Somasundaram and Dan Rosenzweig-Ziff
item.description: Read more

item.title: Texas megachurch shooter had troubled past, police say
item.dc:creator: Molly Hennessy-Fiske and Michelle Boorstein
item.description: The shooter’s 7-year-old son remains hospitalized in critical condition. Law enforcement officials are investigating how she purchased the guns involved.

item.title: Austin released after latest hospitalization, to recover at home
item.dc:creator: Dan Lamothe
item.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin underwent procedures on his bladder Monday, marking the third time he’s been hospitalized since a prostate cancer diagnosis.

item.title: Man charged in theft, destruction of Jackie Robinson statue
item.dc:creator: Glynn A. Hill
item.description: Wichita police said the theft of the bronze statue did not appear to be a hate-motivated crime and probably was driven by financial gain from scrapping metal.

item.title: A tornado swept away her grandparents’ photo years ago. She just got it back.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Page
item.description: “I was in so much shock when the picture popped up,” said Hope Tomkins, lost almost everything in a tornado that destroyed her Iowa home in 2008.

item.title: Prabowo, former general accused of human rights abuses, claims victory in Indonesia’s election
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan and Winda Charmila
item.description: Read more

item.title: Russian court sentences sociologist to five years for criticizing war
item.dc:creator: Mary Ilyushina and Natalia Abbakumova
item.description: The sociologist, Boris Kagarlitsky, initially was ordered to pay a fine but now faces jail. Russian authorities said they also want to arrest Estonia’s prime minister.

item.title: After Pakistan’s shocking election result, all eyes are on the generals
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: The question now is how the establishment will respond to their unprecedented failure to politically sideline the party: More crackdowns on Khan and his allies or by trying to reconcile with the ex-premier?

item.title: Teacher sued over accusations he tried to sell junior high students’ art
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: The students were told to make a piece in the style of Basquiat. Then they found their art for sale online on almost 3,000 items, such as cushions and bags.

item.title: Stories of love and loss in the shadow of Ukraine’s war
item.dc:creator: Natalie Keyssar
item.description: The love stories photographer Natalie Keyssar witnessed are bright spots in the darkest of times.

item.title: Short of options, Gazans try to flee Rafah ahead of Israeli operation
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor, Hazem Balousha and Jennifer Hassan
item.description: The Washington Post spoke to several Gazans in Rafah who said they were trying to head north to Gaza’s central region amid the threat of an Israeli operation.

item.title: Biden and Jordanian king warn about planned Israeli invasion of Rafah
item.dc:creator: Yasmeen Abutaleb and Matt Viser
item.description: The president appeared alongside an Arab leader at the White House for the first time since the Israel-Gaza war began.

item.title: Panic mounts in Rafah over looming Israeli offensive after night strikes killed dozens
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Louisa Loveluck and Hajar Harb
item.description: U.N. chief António Guterres, noting that half of Gaza’s population is already crammed into Rafah, said that the looming Israeli campaign “would exponentially increase what is already a humanitarian nightmare.”

item.title: U.S. strikes on militias, some backed by Iran, rile key ally in Iraq
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mustafa Salim, Missy Ryan and Abigail Hauslohner
item.description: Many see them as an assault on Iraq’s independence, and while Iran supports Iraq’s mainly Shiite militias, they’re also intertwined with society and government.

item.title: Vijay Iyer wants to be heard loud and clear
item.dc:creator: Chris Richards
item.description: Read more

item.title: Jon Stewart saves ‘The Daily Show’ (and vice versa)
item.dc:creator: Lili Loofbourow
item.description: After eight years away from that desk and that chair, Jon Stewart returns to “The Daily Show” eager to stir the pot.

item.title: The sidewalk turns into a catwalk during New York Fashion Week
item.dc:creator: Moira Haney, Annaliese Nurnberg and Ashley Fetters Maloy
item.description: Photographers document street style at New York Fashion Week.

item.title: ‘The New Look’ isn’t as new as one might wish
item.dc:creator: Lili Loofbourow
item.description: “The New Look” explores how Chanel, Dior and other Paris couturiers navigated the perils and temptations of the German occupation.

item.title: The best Broadway love songs about the love you feel right now
item.dc:creator: Washington Post staff
item.description: A musical-theater love song playlist that will help you make sense of your feelings.

item.title: Kanye West and Ty Dolla $ign’s ‘Vultures 1’ is slim pickings
item.dc:creator: Chris Richards
item.description: Ye’s newest music isn’t a complete mess. But “Vultures 1,” a collaboration with singer Ty Dolla $ign, feels like a far cry from Ye’s highest heights.

item.title: Synetic Theater reprises its riveting ‘Romeo & Juliet’
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Ritzel
item.description: With its seamless and searing revival of “Romeo & Juliet,” Synetic Theater is banking on nostalgia and casting changes to bring audiences back.

item.title: D.C.’s ‘queer living room’ was struggling. Then came $150K in donations.

item.description: Read more

item.title: Three D.C police officers shot in Southeast Washington, union says
item.dc:creator: Peter Hermann
item.description: The labor group said the injuries do not appear to be life-threatening.

item.title: How many bullets can a gun have in D.C? Appeals court weighs the question.
item.dc:creator: Salvador Rizzo
item.description: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit appeared divided on whether a law in the District that bans large-capacity magazines should be blocked as unconstitutional.

item.title: Walgreens manager charged in four store robberies that sparked fear about crime in Chinatown
item.dc:creator: Peter Hermann
item.description: Authorities allege the rash of robberies at the Walgreens pharmacy were an inside job, attributable to a single group.

item.title: Make your own DMV-edition Valentine’s Day card to share your love
item.dc:creator: Emily Wright, Agnes Lee, Shikha Subramaniam, Aadit Tambe and Stephanie Hays
item.description: Choose from 10 sweet and silly prompts and stickers based on D.C., Maryland and Virginia to create a custom Valentine’s Day card to download and share.

item.title: D.C.-area forecast: Chilly breeze today, another snow chance heading into the weekend
item.dc:creator: Dan Stillman
item.description: Our weather should be seasonably cool and mostly calm before and after the chance of snow Friday night into early Saturday.

item.title: 8 of the D.C. area’s most romantic restaurants
item.dc:creator: Zoe Glasser
item.description: Looking for a special-occasion spot with a graceful atmosphere and indulgent dishes? The Post’s food critics will show you to your table.

item.title: Black history is ‘being attacked.’ These parents found alternatives.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Hatzipanagos and Emmanuel Felton
item.description: Read more

item.title: He unearthed his roots. Now he digs up lost stories of enslaved people.
item.dc:creator: Sydney Page
item.description: Read more

item.title: A learning kit misidentified civil rights leaders. Here’s who they were.

item.description: Read more

item.title: New ‘Peanuts’ special will finally let Franklin sit by White friends
item.dc:creator: Samantha Chery
item.description: Read more

item.title: Aggressive fungus caused meningitis outbreak tied to clinics in Mexico
item.dc:creator: Sabrina Malhi
item.description: A study reveals the extent of the damage from a meningitis outbreak that led to the deaths of 12 Americans, further highlighting the dangers of medical tourism.

item.title: CDC plans to drop five-day covid isolation guidelines
item.dc:creator: Lena H. Sun
item.description: People with covid will be able to return to school, work and society if they have been fever-free for 24 hours and their symptoms are mild and improving.

item.title: The bubonic plague is still around in 2024. How is that possible?
item.dc:creator: Adela Suliman
item.description: A case of plague was recently confirmed in rural Oregon. The disease known as the Black Death centuries ago is rare and much more treatable in modern times.

item.title: Do apes joke around?
item.dc:creator: Kasha Patel
item.description: The most common behaviors were poking, hitting, hindering movement, body slamming, and pulling on another’s body part — all behaviors observed among humans, too.

item.title: In Valentine’s story at the zoo, beaver courtship began with a bite
item.dc:creator: Martin Weil
item.description: Aspen, a 7-year-old male beaver, and Juniper, a 1-year-old female, are now serenely living together, the National Zoo said last week.

item.title: Pliosaur, T. rex of the sea, is the Jurassic monster of the moment
item.dc:creator: William Booth
item.description: An amazing fossil find and David Attenborough have helped boost the profile of this marine predator that lived in the age of dinosaurs.

item.title: Nobody handles the cruelty of losing better than Kyle Shanahan
item.dc:creator: Sally Jenkins
item.description: When the smoke of social media clears, what’s left is this simple truth: Losing is more instructive to watch than winning.

item.title: Fueled by Swifties, Super Bowl was most-watched telecast ever
item.dc:creator: Ben Strauss
item.description: With 123.7 million viewers on Sunday, the NFL continued to defy the trends of linear television, where viewership for big events has been falling.

item.title: How Andy Reid stacks up against the greatest coaches in NFL history
item.dc:creator: Neil Greenberg
item.description: Patrick Mahomes argued that Andy Reid is the best coach in NFL history. Does he have a case?

item.title: ‘Tired of losing,’ Capitals come up short again against the Avalanche
item.dc:creator: Bailey Johnson
item.description: Washington managed one win in a daunting stretch of four games against top teams, and it has just one victory in its past nine games overall.

item.title: Virginia’s 23-game home winning streak ends with loss to Pittsburgh
item.dc:creator: Gene Wang
item.description: The No. 21 Cavaliers also had won eight in a row overall before Tuesday’s 74-63 loss in Charlottesville.

item.title: When it’s time to financially cut off your adult children
item.dc:creator: Michelle Singletary
item.description: Can you be too generous? There’s a fine line between helping and hindering your grown-up sons and daughters on their path to becoming financially responsible citizens.

item.title: Uber, Lyft drivers to strike on Valentine’s Day over pay
item.dc:creator: Lauren Kaori Gurley
item.description: Thousands of Uber, Lyft, and Doordash drivers are expected to strike on Wednesday, in what organizers say will be the largest nationwide work stoppages against the gig economy giants to date.

item.title: Inflation came in slightly hotter than analysts expected, causing markets to flash red
item.dc:creator: Rachel Siegel
item.description: It came in slightly hotter than analysts expected, causing the markets to flash red.

item.title: Federal Reserve’s interest rate hikes no match for the Rockettes
item.dc:creator: David J. Lynch
item.description: If the Fed’s interest rate increases had worked the way they usually did, Americans would have responded by cutting their spending. Instead, the economy has powered ahead.
